intro: Calceolaria colquepatana, commonly known as the Andean slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh climate of its habitat. Calceolaria colquepatana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated for its striking floral display.
